response:
High-resolution MRI is required urgently to confirm brainstem and optic nerve lesions and distinguish demyelination from stroke or tumour; CSF analysis and autoimmune serology help differentiate multiple sclerosis from NMOSD, MOGAD, and other inflammatory mimics; routine blood tests check for metabolic mimics and treatment contraindications, while electrophysiological and ophthalmologic studies further document optic nerve dysfunction.

investigations = ["MRI of brain, orbits, and whole spine with gadolinium contrast", "MR angiography of head and neck", "Lumbar puncture with CSF opening pressure measurement", "CSF cell count and differential", "CSF protein and glucose", "CSF oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "CSF bacterial culture", "CSF viral PCR panel (including HSV, VZV, enteroviruses)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Serum vitamin D", "Serum aquaporin-4 (AQP4) antibodies", "Serum MOG (myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein) antibodies", "Antinuclear antibody (ANA)", "Extractable nuclear antigen (ENA) panel", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies (ANCA)", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE)", "Syphilis serology (non-treponemal and treponemal tests)", "HIV antigen/antibody test", "Lyme disease serology", "Visual evoked potentials", "Optical coherence tomography of optic nerves", "Baseline ECG"]
